SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.levels

Class LevelConfig

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.levels.LevelConfig
public class LevelConfig extends Object
Represents the configuration settings for a specific game level.

This class acts as a blueprint, holding all the necessary visual and gameplay parameters that define a particular level within the game. These parameters include aspects such as the background's appearance, the music played during the level, the time limit for completion, the maximum number of enemies present, and the player's movement speed.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelConfig

      public LevelConfig(List<String> backgroundImagePaths, String musicClipName, int levelTimeLimitSeconds, int maxEnemies, int playerSpeed, Color backgroundColor, LevelType levelType)
      Constructs a LevelConfig object with the specified configuration parameters for a game level.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImagePaths - A List of String file paths to the background images used in this level. This list can contain multiple paths for scrolling background effects. Must not be null or empty.
      musicClipName - A String representing the name of the sound clip to be played as background music during this level. Can be null if no music is intended.
      levelTimeLimitSeconds - An int specifying the time limit for completing this level, measured in seconds. Must be a non-negative value.
      maxEnemies - An int representing the maximum number of enemy entities that can be present on the game screen simultaneously during this level. Must be a non-negative value.
      playerSpeed - An int indicating the movement speed of the player character within this level. Higher values typically mean faster movement. Must be a positive value.
      backgroundColor - A Color object specifying the fallback background color to be used if loading the background image(s) from backgroundImagePaths fails. Must not be null.
      levelType - A LevelType enum constant indicating the specific type of this level (e.g., classroom, hallway). Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If backgroundImagePaths, backgroundColor, or levelType is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - If levelTimeLimitSeconds or maxEnemies is negative, or if playerSpeed is not positive.

  • Method Details

    • getBackgroundImagePaths

      public List<String> getBackgroundImagePaths()
      Returns the list of file paths for the background images used in this level. This list is used to create a scrolling background effect.
      Returns:
      A List of String paths to the background image files. May be empty if no background image is specified.

    • getMusicClipName

      public String getMusicClipName()
      Returns the name of the music clip to be played as background music during this level.
      Returns:
      A String representing the name of the music clip, or null if no background music is intended for this level.

    • getLevelTimeLimitSeconds

      public int getLevelTimeLimitSeconds()
      Returns the time limit for completing this level, in seconds.
      Returns:
      An int representing the time limit in seconds.

    • getMaxEnemies

      public int getMaxEnemies()
      Returns the maximum number of enemy entities that are allowed to be present on the game screen simultaneously during this level.
      Returns:
      An int representing the maximum number of enemies.

    • getPlayerSpeed

      public int getPlayerSpeed()
      Returns the movement speed of the player character within this level. Higher values indicate faster movement.
      Returns:
      An int representing the player's movement speed.

    • getBackgroundColor

      public Color getBackgroundColor()
      Returns the fallback background color for this level. This color will be used if loading the background image(s) fails.
      Returns:
      A Color object representing the fallback background color. Will not be null.

    • getLevelType

      public LevelType getLevelType()
      Returns the specific type of this level, as defined by the LevelType enum.
      Returns:
      A LevelType enum constant representing the type of this level. Will not be null.
